title: Is Drake really that great? - Quora

response.answer_text: To be honest, no, not really (As you can read from my credentials, I’ll only be judging Drake on the rap side of things, so Drake fans, get off my case) (I’ve decided I’ll be answering cleanly, my last answer to this sort of topic got collapsed, so) I rarely ever hear him rap, like, the only time I heard him rap was in Forever, and that had the likes of Kanye West, Lil Wayne and Eminem in it. Yes I do hear him at times try to sing-rhyme Taylor Swift style as if he was some kind of Nate Dogg wannabe or something. See, he’s being put alongside the likes of Lil Wayne and Nicki Minaj, and while both of which are just as bad as rappers (though Lil Wayne is capable of being semi-decent), he looks like Rihanna amongst Metallica, it simply doesn’t work. I can sort of see where Drake is trying to aim at with his versatile style of music making, but it doesn’t work that way, it’s almost like thinking Maths was the same as Economics, though it has some corelation, it’s absolutely not the same, you can mix heavy metal and rock and roll since it’s got a lot of similarities, if not exactly the same, but hip-hop and pop music is a proper mess that rarely ever works, just look at Christina Aguilera’s Dirrty music video featuring Redman or Taylor Swift’s Bad Blood music video featuring Kendrick Lamar and you’ll know what I mean That’s all I got to say, Drake doesn’t satisfy my hip-hop needs, in fact, it actually upsets my hip-hop needs, I’m off to listen to a load of rappers people recommended in the comment section of my now collapsed answer, I’m starting with Immortal Technique from here. Peace

Absolutely! I never liked Rap music. I wouldn't give it the time of day...until Drake came along. He turned me into a fan. I even got to see Drake in concert and totally loved it. I went with my 21 year old daughter. His concert is one of the most memorable concerts I've ever been to. And this is coming for a 50+ year old woman. Drake is the BOMB!
